This file describes simulated data sets used for testing IRT procedures in the psychometrics java library.


zabel-jan15.csv
----------------------------------------------------------------
A file with 1000 examinees and 30 items generated from a 2PL.
The scaling constant D=1.0. Examinees generated from a N(0,1)
distribution.

The generating item parameters were:
      aparam     bparam
 [1,] 0.8549622  0.48682180
 [2,] 0.9561389  0.08423029
 [3,] 1.0531747  0.63284817
 [4,] 0.9953371 -0.31045108
 [5,] 1.0264296 -1.23702941
 [6,] 0.9801564  1.01223218
 [7,] 0.6519025  0.48936731
 [8,] 1.5086711  0.93404282
 [9,] 1.0821341  0.64615845
[10,] 0.9831487  1.00775498
[11,] 1.1816602  1.58771699
[12,] 0.9231413  0.80970867
[13,] 0.6595269 -1.48858744
[14,] 1.0497806  0.12818240
[15,] 1.1411616  2.08468036
[16,] 1.4704886  0.23871900
[17,] 0.9884686 -1.38569721
[18,] 1.3229713 -1.12661354
[19,] 0.8318261 -0.08706222
[20,] 1.2917195  0.94504988
[21,] 0.9657596 -0.32981723
[22,] 1.1442172 -0.18863410
[23,] 1.5315144  0.58550103
[24,] 0.7211808  1.53631771
[25,] 1.1239965  1.39622991
[26,] 0.9668773  0.59188473
[27,] 1.3511907  1.34768278
[28,] 0.9982256  0.55603778
[29,] 0.8237846  0.30951355
[30,] 1.0251304 -1.52426050



lemond-jan15.csv
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A file with 1,500 examinees and 40 binary items. This file has 8 items in common with the file
fignon-jan15.csv. The two files may be used to demonstrate IRT linking. The commons items are
item1, item6, item11, item16, item21, item27, item32, item37. The person distribution was
generated from a N(0,1) distribution. The generating theta values are included in the data file.

The generating item parameters were:
         aparam     bparam    cparam
 [1,] 0.6635862 -0.4886408 0.2455597
 [2,] 1.2333454 -2.2077665 0.1244460
 [3,] 1.2126437 -0.1979198 0.1857492
 [4,] 1.0843519 -1.7146029 0.2093792
 [5,] 1.3118093  0.5975218 0.1483612
 [6,] 0.8691046 -1.2248102 0.1292454
 [7,] 1.3289232  0.8663743 0.1566887
 [8,] 0.7926336 -0.4576632 0.1113021
 [9,] 1.0238758 -1.6983928 0.2108033
[10,] 1.2970019 -0.5762680 0.1663203
[11,] 0.7459793 -1.2102145 0.2172177
[12,] 0.6155420 -0.4620614 0.1392037
[13,] 0.9946387  0.9531894 0.1471425
[14,] 0.9773723  0.3804866 0.1074727
[15,] 1.2320163  0.9964454 0.2082688
[16,] 0.8649159 -0.6970625 0.2145915
[17,] 0.9246924  1.7903167 0.1884344
[18,] 0.7193132  0.8092945 0.2069766
[19,] 1.3354426  0.3698184 0.2104365
[20,] 0.5336984 -1.7896386 0.1686832
[21,] 1.0418239  0.4499151 0.2309323
[22,] 0.5995399  0.6975358 0.1968779
[23,] 0.9169525 -0.3704270 0.1786674
[24,] 1.0696751 -1.7836483 0.2499511
[25,] 1.4476336 -0.9230813 0.2445687
[26,] 1.2098207 -1.2408840 0.1385729
[27,] 0.9646403  1.0207562 0.1421537
[28,] 0.7631981 -0.4770651 0.1020598
[29,] 1.2561597  0.1639198 0.1903394
[30,] 0.9895476 -1.1324068 0.1494744
[31,] 1.0228906 -0.6019638 0.2317993
[32,] 1.2568366  0.2380213 0.1099360
[33,] 1.0530720  0.8100197 0.1510440
[34,] 0.8425682 -0.6719697 0.1066356
[35,] 0.8910957 -1.7547112 0.1087836
[36,] 0.6408879  0.0743821 0.1362877
[37,] 0.7735543  0.5231083 0.1914761
[38,] 1.3887836 -0.7776355 0.1903612
[39,] 0.8720758 -0.1776411 0.2174501
[40,] 0.9257739 -0.8423231 0.1253471



fignon-jan15.csv
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A file with 2,000 examinees and 40 binary items. This file has 8 items in common with the file
lemond-jan15.csv. The two files may be used to demonstrate IRT linking. The commons items are
item1, item6, item11, item16, item21, item27, item32, item37. The person distribution was
generated from a N(-0.4,1) distribution. The generating theta values are included in the data file.

The generating item parameters were:
         aparam      bparam    cparam
 [1,] 0.6635862 -0.48864081 0.2455597
 [2,] 0.8424227  0.33990867 0.1031262
 [3,] 1.2207861  0.87302294 0.1745203
 [4,] 1.4372302  0.14593053 0.1025539
 [5,] 0.7005197 -0.98419615 0.1184298
 [6,] 0.8691046 -1.22481017 0.1292454
 [7,] 0.5894962 -1.84625327 0.2007719
 [8,] 0.9571796  0.17551858 0.1491484
 [9,] 0.9051713  0.26619414 0.1517530
[10,] 0.7692478 -2.15839355 0.1068184
[11,] 0.7459793 -1.21021452 0.2172177
[12,] 1.1046800  0.07286138 0.1546567
[13,] 1.2898251 -0.63181379 0.2375137
[14,] 0.7440297 -0.58141344 0.1187204
[15,] 1.0605563 -2.05069244 0.1350588
[16,] 0.8649159 -0.69706253 0.2145915
[17,] 0.9816544  0.72038103 0.1064419
[18,] 1.1369408 -0.11739472 0.1416963
[19,] 1.1978280 -0.80236549 0.1510951
[20,] 1.2222706 -0.17903666 0.1357114
[21,] 1.0418239  0.44991515 0.2309323
[22,] 1.5965278  0.53126895 0.1580073
[23,] 0.9714092 -1.11405252 0.2481641
[24,] 0.8650321 -0.72427208 0.2170899
[25,] 1.4678319  0.01985382 0.1440587
[26,] 1.1292251 -1.52354104 0.2337171
[27,] 0.9646403  1.02075618 0.1421537
[28,] 0.8132580 -0.71949641 0.1712696
[29,] 0.9328481  2.22678800 0.1719233
[30,] 1.3338112 -0.70893148 0.1298811
[31,] 0.9189135  0.08239934 0.1134361
[32,] 1.2568366  0.23802131 0.1099360
[33,] 1.2098431 -0.80174032 0.1243301
[34,] 1.0795483  0.16703510 0.2138908
[35,] 0.7496796 -1.17226462 0.2048360
[36,] 1.0926953 -0.17666699 0.1477963
[37,] 0.7735543  0.52310829 0.1914761
[38,] 0.9729383  1.72018499 0.2248589
[39,] 1.0708111  1.56156299 0.2485539
[40,] 1.0606725 -1.10864342 0.2492087



hampsten-feb16.csv
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A file with 2000 examinees and 30 items generated from a 2PL. The scaling constant D=1.0. Examinees generated from a normal
mixture distribution with two modes, The first 500 examinees (25%) generated from a Normal(-1.5, 0.5) distribution and the
next 1500 examinees (75%) generated from a Normal(0.5, 0.5) distribution. The mean of the observed theta values was
0.00245 and the standard deviation was 1.0065. Discriminaiton parameters were generated from a lognormal(0, 0.45) distribution
and the difficulty parameters were generated from a normal(0, 1) distribution. The generating theta values are included in the data file.

The generating item parameters were:
         aparam     bparam
 [1,] 1.2983538  1.6874376
 [2,] 1.1926286 -1.4805832
 [3,] 0.4020026 -0.1305489
 [4,] 1.2812232  3.1225299
 [5,] 0.9342388  1.0925597
 [6,] 0.5279618  0.3648419
 [7,] 1.6634825  1.0343360
 [8,] 1.1035921 -0.1740715
 [9,] 0.5907409 -0.2079247
[10,] 1.1348501  0.4023286
[11,] 2.6335303 -0.3205654
[12,] 1.5640821 -0.3483266
[13,] 1.9388105  0.7342640
[14,] 1.1539565 -0.5476661
[15,] 1.3567217  1.7272678
[16,] 0.2435360 -0.6127585
[17,] 0.7317515  0.3080275
[18,] 0.9333136 -1.5732073
[19,] 0.6699312 -1.3129444
[20,] 0.8955131 -0.8377228
[21,] 1.0802679  0.3123178
[22,] 0.5983257 -0.5559169
[23,] 1.0718136  1.2415179
[24,] 2.3048463 -0.3705632
[25,] 1.9330056 -1.0142115
[26,] 2.3363644  0.2994043
[27,] 2.0005050 -0.3022560
[28,] 0.8565745  0.1178912
[29,] 0.9968405 -1.2778833
[30,] 0.5672946  1.3736907




phinney-feb16.csv
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A file with 2000 examinees and 30 items generated from a 2PL. The scaling constant D=1.0. Examinees generated from a normal
mixture distribution to have negative skew. The first 400 examinees (20%) generated from a Normal distribution with a mean=-1.259
and a standard deviation = 1.3383. The next 1600 examinees (80%) generated from a Normal distribution with a mean = 0.315 and a standard
deviation = 0.5541. These latent distribution parameters are from Casabianca and Lewis (2015) Journal of Educational and Behavioral Statistics.
The mean of the observed theta values was 0.0061 and the standard deviation was 1.0446. Discriminaiton parameters were generated from a
lognormal(0, 0.45) distribution and the difficulty parameters were generated from a normal(0, 1) distribution. The generating theta values
are included in the data file.

The generating item parameters were:
         aparam     bparam
 [1,] 0.5173125  0.6562352
 [2,] 1.9990793  0.7767028
 [3,] 1.1258410  0.8833187
 [4,] 0.4989343 -1.0554939
 [5,] 0.7809387  0.1043215
 [6,] 0.6302186  0.3159130
 [7,] 0.5676108 -0.0596449
 [8,] 2.4783543 -0.6595300
 [9,] 0.7893335  0.7937452
[10,] 1.4005124 -0.0559267
[11,] 0.8687658 -1.2146896
[12,] 1.4301494  1.3225108
[13,] 1.5215959  1.3872623
[14,] 0.9505272 -0.9829757
[15,] 0.5752940 -1.0297850
[16,] 0.8613963  0.5958823
[17,] 0.9940007 -0.6918580
[18,] 1.4692539  0.1292134
[19,] 0.9583280  0.9539162
[20,] 0.4350880 -0.2033353
[21,] 1.1703801 -0.3002847
[22,] 0.8043711  0.6910061
[23,] 0.5969575  0.2960927
[24,] 0.8412868  0.0241366
[25,] 0.8014721  0.0031041
[26,] 0.3547581 -0.4022617
[27,] 0.6700294 -1.0415943
[28,] 0.8850407 -0.4608017
[29,] 0.4340622  1.1354111
[30,] 0.5714566 -1.9761360
